Body:
Description: We have purchased the enterprise version of PingCastle. The product information shows 
License issued: April 14, 2024
Expiration date: April 13, 2025

I do not have the access to training that I expected

"Product training is available for customers only.
But you can browse our free educational content."

It does not appear as though my account has been activated properly.

• Sent a followup email to the customer portal team on this.
  • Awaiting response.

Steps to Reproduce Updated: Step 1: Purchase the enterprise version of PingCastle and confirm the license details (e.g., issued date: April 14, 2024, expiration date: April 13, 2025).  
Step 2: Log in to the Netwrix Customer Portal using the account associated with the license.  
Step 3: Navigate to the "Training" section under "My Products."  
Step 4: Attempt to access the training materials; observe that access is restricted despite the valid license.  
Step 5: Review the message displayed: "Product training is available for customers only. But you can browse our free educational content."

(Requested by user 005Qk000003cQkX)

What We've Learned Updated: - The customer's account was not properly activated upon purchasing the enterprise version of PingCastle, leading to restricted access to training materials despite a valid license.
- The license details (issued date: April 14, 2024, expiration date: April 13, 2025) were confirmed to be correct, and the license itself was valid.
- The issue was identified as a setup error in the Netwrix Customer Portal, which affected access to training resources.
- A valid license was provided to the customer as a temporary measure to ensure continued use of PingCastle while the account activation issue was being resolved.
- The customer's access to training materials was eventually corrected, and they were able to confirm access to PingCastle under "My Products" and the training section.
- It was communicated that PingCastle is a newer acquisition, and the availability of training materials is currently limited, with more content being developed and planned for release.
- The customer emphasized the importance of accessing training materials to learn more about the solution, highlighting a need for timely updates on available courses.

(Requested by user 005Qk000003cQkX)

Next Steps Updated: 1. Shaheryar Ali will follow up with the training team to confirm what courses are available for PingCastle and provide an update to James Hartzog once the information is obtained.  
2. James Hartzog is requested to log in to the Netwrix Customer Portal and confirm whether he now has access to PingCastle under "My Products" and the training section.  
3. Shaheryar Ali will continue working with the license team to ensure all issues related to training access are fully resolved and communicate any updates to James Hartzog.

(Requested by user 005Qk000003cQkX)
